info.title: ADPQ Knowledge Management Tool
info.description:
**Demo**
[https://adpq.hotbsoftware.com](https://adpq.hotbsoftware.com)

**Credentials**

**Staff Account**
**Username:** adpq-staff.hotbsoftware.com
**PW:** Hotb&2018

**Admin Account**
**Username:** adpq-admin.hotbsoftware.com
**PW:** Hotb&2018

**Description**
This page contains the API documentation for the HOTB Software submission for the Agile Development Prequalified Vendor Pool in March 2018. All documentation conforms to the OpenAPI v3.0.0 specification.

**Getting Started**
Please refer to our [GitHub Page](https://github.com/HOTB-Software/adpq-2018) for additional documentation and instructions for setting up a local development environment. All requests listed on this page are currently operational. Please make sure to read the authentication instructions as well as review the list of status codes.

**Authentication**
Many of the requests found in this API require authentication via JWT. Upon successful log in you will receive an authentication token. Please use the token as the value for the 'Authorization' header to validate your credentials for subsequent requests.

**API Limitations**
The number of API requests from each ip address is throttled based on repeated usage. When the limit is reached an error with status code **429** for 'Too Many Requests' will be returned with a timestamp for the next allowed request. To remove this restriction for a specific ip address please email us with your name, company, a phone number we can reach you at, and the ip address to be whitelisted.


**Status Codes**
Code Description
200 Success
400 Bad Request
401 Unauthorized
404 Page Not Found
429 Too Many Requests


Have a great day!
(っˆڡˆς)

post.description: This endpoint allows a user to sign in via email and password. Upon successful login you will receive a JWT token to be used for all subsequent requests as well as some basic information about the user.

get.description: To be used on admin manage users screen to view all users

post.description: To be used by admin to create a new user capable of article CRUD

patch.description: To be used by admin to update a single user according to parameters set

get.description: To be used by to get all relevant details of a single user

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Numeric ID of the user to get

delete.description: To be used by admin to archive a user from the ADPQ System

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Numeric ID of the user to delete

patch.description: To be used by user to edit their own profile according to parameters set

get.description: To be used by user or admin to get either user-pertinent or site-wide statistics depending on role
To be used by user to view top trending articles on dashboard, articles return are changed according to learning algorithm
To be used by user to view user's latest published articles on dashboard

get.summary: Get the latest articles with status updates
get.description: To be used by user to view the user's own unreviewed and declined articles on dashboard

get.summary: Get the latest articles with status updates
get.description: To be used by admin to view recent declined articles on dashboard

get.summary: Get the latest articles with status updates
get.description: To be used by admin to view recent approved articles on dashboard

get.summary: Get the latest articles with status updates
get.description: To be used by admin to view recent pending articles on dashboard
To be used by admin or user to view a list of articles according to various filter parameters

post.description: To be used by a staff member (only) to create a new article

example.title: Very interesting test article
example.tags: one, panda, two, pandas, three, nopanda

get.description: To be used by admin or user to view all relevant details of an article

parameters.name: articleId
parameters.description: Id of the article to return

delete.description: To be used by an admin at any point to delete an article completely

parameters.name: articleId
parameters.description: Id of the article to return

get.description: Used to get all staff articles

post.description: To be used by either author or admin to update article properties

example.title: Edited interesting test article
example.shortDesc: This is a less short description
example.longDesc: This is a much longer description......

post.description: To be used by any staff user or admin to post a comment onto a specific article

patch.summary: Increment the view count of a published article
patch.description: This endpoint will increment the view count of a published article (The article MUST be published to increment the count)

parameters.name: articleId
parameters.description: Id of the article to view

patch.summary: Increment the share count of an article
patch.description: This endpoint will increment the share count of a published article (The article MUST be published to increment the count)

parameters.name: articleId
parameters.description: Id of the article to return

post.description: To be used by admin to change the status of an article from 'pending' to 'published'
To be used by admin to change the status of an article from 'pending' to 'declined'

patch.description: To be used while editing an article, removes select attachment from an article

post.summary: Get a pre-signed url to use for uploading attachments
post.description: To be used by the front end to receive the url to prepend to attachments

get.summary: Get a list of all agencies
get.description: To be used by the front end to receive a list of agencies, sorted alphabetically

get.summary: Get a list of all tags
get.description: To be used by the front end to receive a list of tags, sorted alphabetically
To be used by the front end to receive a list of tags, sorted by trending algorithm
